00020 
00021 #ifndef KM_TERM_H
00022 #define KM_TERM_H
00023 
00024 #include "KMeans.h"
00025 
00026 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00027 //  KMterm - termination condition
00028 //      This structure is used for storing information controlling the
00029 //      termination and phase changes of the various algorithms.
00030 //
00031 //    Maximum Total Stages:
00032 //    ---------------------
00033 //    The algorithm is terminated after some maximum number of stages
00034 //    have been performed.  Rather than computing this as a fixed
00035 //    constant, it is given as a function of n (number of data points)
00036 //    and k (number of centers).  We use the following formula, where
00037 //    the coefficients a, ..., d are supplied by the user (see
00038 //    kmltest.cpp).
00039 //
00040 //        MAX_STAGE = a + (b*k + c*n)^d
00041 //
00042 //    Parameters Determining Phase/Run Transitions:
00043 //    ---------------------------------------------
00044 //    The local improvement algorithms consist of a series of stages,
00045 //    which are grouped into "runs" and series of runs are grouped in
00046 //    "phases".  The meaning of these groupings depends on the
00047 //    particular algorithm. (See KMlocal.h for more information.)  The
00048 //    transition between runs and phases are either based on the
00049 //    number of stages performed or on the change in distortion over
00050 //    the course of the run.
00051 //
00052 //    maxRunStage
00053 //        This is used to limit the maximum number of stages in
00054 //        any run.
00055 //
00056 //    Some transitions are defined in terms of a quantity called the
00057 //    "relative distortion loss" (RDL), which is defined to be the
00058 //    relative decrease in the distortion.  (See KMlocal.h for
00059 //    definition.) The relative distortion loss between the current
00060 //    and previous stages is called the "consecutive RDL" and the
00061 //    relative distortion loss since the start of a run is called the
00062 //    "accumulated RDL".
00063 //
00064 //    minConsecRDL
00065 //        This is used in the hybrid's algorithm.  If the RDL of
00066 //        two consecutive runs is less than this value, Lloyd's
00067 //        algorithm is deemed to have converged.
00068 //    minAccumRDL
00069 //        This is used in run-based algorithms.  It is the RDL of
00070 //        the current distortion relative to the distortion at
00071 //        some prior time (e.g. the start of a run).
00072 //
00073 //    Parameters used in Simulated Annealing
00074 //    --------------------------------------
00075 //    initProbAccept
00076 //        Initial probability of accepting an solution that does
00077 //        not alter the distortion.
00078 //    tempRunLength
00079 //        The number of stages before chaning the temperature.
00080 //    tempReducFactor
00081 //        The factor by which temperature is reduced at the end of
00082 //        a temperature run.
00083 //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 
00085 enum {                // entry names
00086     KM_TERM_CONST,        // constant term
00087     KM_TERM_LIN_K,        // linear k multiplier
00088     KM_TERM_LIN_N,        // linear n multiplier
00089     KM_TERM_POW,        // power exponent
00090     KM_TERM_VEC_LEN};        // length of termination param vector
00091 
00092 class KMterm {
00093 private:
00094     double   maxTotStageVec[KM_TERM_VEC_LEN];    // max total stages
00095     double   minConsecRDL;            // min consecutive RDL
00096     double   minAccumRDL;            // min accumulated RDL
00097     int         maxRunStage;            // max stages/run for Lloyd's
00098     double   initProbAccept;            // initial prob. of acceptance
00099     int      tempRunLength;            // length of temp run
00100     double   tempReducFact;            // temperature reduction factor
00101 
00102 protected:                    // stage count
00103     int maxStage(const double param[KM_TERM_VEC_LEN], int k, int n) const;
00104 public:
00105     KMterm();                     // default constructor
00106     KMterm(                    // standard constructor
00107     double a, double b, double c, double d,    // maxTotStage
00108     double mcr, double mar, int mrs,
00109     double ipa, int trl, double trf);
00110     
00111     void setMaxTotStage(int i, double val) {    // set max stage parameters
00112         assert(i >= 0 && i < KM_TERM_VEC_LEN);
00113     maxTotStageVec[i] = val;
00114     }
00115     void setAbsMaxTotStage(int s) {        // set max number of stages
00116         maxTotStageVec[KM_TERM_CONST] = s;
00117     maxTotStageVec[KM_TERM_POW] = 0;
00118     }
00119     int getMaxTotStage(int k, int n) const    // max total stages
00120       {  return maxStage(maxTotStageVec, k, n); }
00121 
00122     double getMinConsecRDL() const        // return min consec RDL
00123       { return minConsecRDL; }
00124 
00125     double getMinAccumRDL() const        // return min accum RDL
00126       { return minAccumRDL; }
00127 
00128     int getMaxRunStage() const            // return max runs per stage
00129       { return maxRunStage; }
00130 
00131     void setMinConsecRDL(double rdl)        // set min consec RDL
00132       {  minConsecRDL = rdl; }
00133 
00134     void setMinAccumRDL(double rdl)        // set min accum RDL
00135       {  minAccumRDL = rdl; }
00136 
00137     void setMaxRunStage(int ms)            // set max runs per stage
00138       {  maxRunStage = ms; }
00139 
00140     double getInitProbAccept() const        // return init. prob. accept
00141       {  return initProbAccept; }
00142 
00143     void setInitProbAccept(double ipa)        // set init. prob. accept
00144       {  initProbAccept = ipa; }
00145 
00146     int getTempRunLength() const        // return temperature run len.
00147       { return tempRunLength; }
00148 
00149     void setTempRunLength(int trl)        // set temperature run length
00150       { tempRunLength = trl; }
00151 
00152     double getTempReducFact() const        // return temp. reduction fact.
00153       { return tempReducFact; }
00154 
00155     void setTempReducFact(double trf)        // set temp. reduction fact.
00156       { tempReducFact = trf; }
00157 };
00158 #endif
